channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2024040258
item.description:
Report E-2024040258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNJ experienced a UN1210 PS-PX93 Proshine Process Ext. release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to a 36’ x 24’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents were collected into (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040298
item.description:
Report E-2024040298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: MERCERVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2.5 gallons of EnduraSTRIP released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to a forklift puncture. It was reported that the release was caught onto a drip pad and pallet and nothing impacted the trailer floor or dock. Terminal personnel had already cleaned and containerized the release prior to notifying ERTS. The damaged plastic pail and spent absorbent pads were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040295
item.description:
Report X-2024040295

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during the sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, and 2 of 4 items with loose caps. Package was also poorly attempted to be repacked, but it only made the damage worse, because items were place upside down. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024040254
item.description:
Report X-2024040254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE UNLOADING TRAILER PH NOTICED PACKAGE WAS WET. PH PLACED BOX INTO HAZMAT TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. DescribePack: CAP TO ALCOHOL N.O.S. 1 GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE AND LIQUID LEAKED THROUGHOUT PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA TOOK PACKAGE TO DAMAGE HAZMAT CAGE AND PLACED INTO A YELLOW DRUM FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024040242
item.description:
Report X-2024040242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES OF CIDECON II WAS FOUND WITH THE CAP LOOSE AND MISSING, IT WAS FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REAMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF CIDECON II COULD CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024040238
item.description:
Report X-2024040238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat in a plastic salvage drum during sunrise sort. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet, torn, punctured and leaking. Most of the package is already destroyed from soaking in its own liquid, and is only identifiable by the relabel barcode placed on top of drum. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining content will be disposed in a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040144
item.description:
Report E-2024040144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XNJ contacted ERTS regarding (6) damaged 1-gallon jugs of Heavy Duty Foam Degreaser that fell during transit as a result of improper loading / improper blocking and bracing. Approximately 2-gallons of product released onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor overpacked the damaged product and neutralized the impacted boxes, plastic, cardboard, and trash can liners using Citri Acid. Three drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040132
item.description:
Report E-2024040132

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: WEST DEPTFORD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XVL contacted ERTS regarding an incident that occurred at a customer’s location. During the off-loading process, a bag containing product SODIUM SULFIDE -FLAKES 60-62 % got caught on the side of the trailer and released approximately 5lbs of production a 1’x1’area onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor cleaned up the release and overpacked the damaged bag of product. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this spill.

item.title: Report E-2024040115
item.description:
Report E-2024040115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 1, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3901 was damaged in transit due to unknown causes and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer floor, pallets, and concrete. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnvioServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The impacted pallet was dismantled for disposal. The dismantled pallet, the damaged drum, all UN3901 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum and nine (9) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.
